definition: unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: This fiasco was worse than any of them, and seemed interminable.
sentences.chinese: 这最糟糕的八分钟是似乎是空前绝后的”。

sentences.english: China today exhibits many of the tell-tale signs of a great speculative mania.
sentences.chinese: 今日中国流露出了许多空前绝后的狂热的踪迹。

sentences.english: After years of research on the dice issues, with unprecedented and unrepeatable breakthrough.
sentences.chinese: 经多年的研究在骰子的问题上，有了空前绝后的突破。

sentences.english: Paris - A global financial crisis of the current magnitude is unique.
sentences.chinese: 这次全球性金融危机是空前绝后的。

sentences.english: Julius Caesar has been called the most unmatched military general in Roman history.
sentences.chinese: 恺撒大帝被称为罗马历史上空前绝后的军事领袖。

definition: to surpass all others of its kind before and since/to have neither predecessors nor successors
pinyin: qian2 wu2 gu3 ren2 hou4 wu2 lai2 zhe3

definition: one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
never before in the whole of history (idiom)/unprecedented
can be rated as/can be said to be
incomparable/none to compare with at that time
to reach great heights (in technical skills or scholastic achievements)
in the extreme (idiom)/incapable of further increase
